MetaData.MetaDataItem: To Exclude your switch, put your HUB in exclusion mode, hold the light up or down button and press the Light on/off button three (3) times.

You may factory reset the switch by holding down the light up or down button and the light on/off button for twenty (20) or more seconds. The LED Bar will turn Red and blink three (3) times to confirm.

put your HUB in exclusion mode, hold the light up or down button and press the Light on/off button three (3) times.
Please Note: If this doesn't work, you can check to see if your switch is within Z-Wave Range by holding down the Light Button for 5-10 seconds (if it's not within range, the LED Bar will indicate Red and if it is within Range, the LED Bar will indicate Green). If your switch indicates Red, please move the switch closer to the HUB. If your switch indicates Green, please try running an Exclusion to reset your switch.

Value.label: Light Dimming Speed
Value.Help: This changes the speed in which the attached light dims up or down. A setting of 0 should turn the light immediately on or off (almost like an on/off switch). Increasing the value should slow down the transition speed. Range:0-98 Default: 4

Value.label: Light Dimming Speed (From Switch)
Value.Help: This changes the speed in which the attached light dims up or down when controlled from the physical switch. A setting of 0 should turn the light immediately on or off (almost like an on/off switch). Increasing the value should slow down the transition speed. A setting of 99 should keep this in sync with parameter 1. Range:0-99 Default: 99

Value.label: Light Ramp Rate
Value.Help: This changes the speed in which the attached light turns on or off. For example, when a user sends the switch a basicSet(value: 0xFF) or basicSet(value: 0x00), this is the speed in which those actions take place. A setting of 0 should turn the light immediately on or off (almost like an on/off switch). Increasing the value should slow down the transition speed. A setting of 99 should keep this in sync with parameter 1. Range:0-99 Default: 99

Value.label: Light Ramp Rate (From Switch)
Value.Help: This changes the speed in which the attached light turns on or off from the physical switch. For example, when a user presses the up or down button, this is the speed in which those actions take place. A setting of 0 should turn the light immediately on or off (almost like an on/off switch). Increasing the value should slow down the transition speed. A setting of 99 should keep this in sync with parameter 1. Range:0-99 Default: 99

Value.label: Minimum Light Level
Value.Help: The minimum level that the dimmer allows the bulb to be dimmed to. Useful when the user has an LED bulb that does not turn on or flickers at a lower level. Range:1-45 Default: 1

Value.label: Maximum Light Level
Value.Help: The maximum level that the dimmer allows the bulb to be dimmed to. Useful when the user has an LED bulb that reaches its maximum level before the dimmer value of 99. Range:55-99 Default: 99

Value.label: Minimum Fan Level
Value.Help: The minimum level that the dimmer allows the fan to be dimmed to. Useful when the user has a fan that does not turn at a lower level. Range:1-45 Default: 1

Value.label: Maximum Fan Level
Value.Help: The maximum level that the dimmer allows the fan to be dimmed to. Range:55-99 Default: 99

Value.label: Auto Off Light Timer
Value.Help: Automatically turns the light switch off after this many seconds. When the switch is turned on a timer is started that is the duration of this setting. When the timer expires, the switch is turned off. Range:0-32767 Default: 0

Value.label: Auto Off Fan Timer
Value.Help: Automatically turns the fan switch off after this many seconds. When the switch is turned on a timer is started that is the duration of this setting. When the timer expires, the switch is turned off. Range:0-32767 Default: 0

Value.label: Default Light Level (Local)
Value.Help: Default level for the dimmer when it is powered on from the local switch. A setting of 0 means that the switch will return to the level that it was on before it was turned off. Range:1-99 Default: 0

Value.label: Default Light Level (Z-Wave)
Value.Help: Default level for the dimmer when it is powered on from a Z-Wave command. A setting of 0 means that the switch will return to the level that it was on before it was turned off. Range:1-99 Default: 0

Value.label: Default Fan Level (Local)
Value.Help: Default level for the fan dimmer when it is powered on from the local switch. Default: Last State

Value.label: Default Fan Level (Z-Wave)
Value.Help: Default level for the fan dimmer when it is powered on from the local switch. Default: Last State

Value.label: Light State After Power Restored
Value.Help: The state the switch should return to once power is restored after power failure. 0 = off, 1-99 = level, 100=previous. Range:0-100 Default: 100

Value.label: Fan State After Power Restored
Value.Help: The state the switch should return to once power is restored after power failure. Default: Off

Value.label: Light LED Indicator Color
Value.Help: This is the color of the Light LED strip represented as part of the HUE color wheel. Since the wheel has 360 values and this parameter only has 255, the following equation can be used to determine the color: value/255 * 350 = Hue color wheel value Range: 0 to 255 Default: 170

Value.label: Light LED Strip Intensity
Value.Help: This is the intensity of the Light LED strip. Range: 0-10 Default: 5

Value.label: Fan LED Indicator Color
Value.Help: This is the color of the Fan LED strip represented as part of the HUE color wheel. Since the wheel has 360 values and this parameter only has 255, the following equation can be used to determine the color: value/255 * 350 = Hue color wheel value Range: 0 to 255 Default: 170

Value.label: Fan LED Strip Intensity
Value.Help: This is the intensity of the Fan LED strip. Range: 0-10 Default: 5

Value.label: Light LED Strip Intensity (When OFF)
Value.Help: This is the intensity of the Light LED strip when the switch is off. This is useful for users to see the light switch location when the lights are off. Range: 0-10 Default: 1

Value.label: Fan LED Strip Intensity (When OFF)
Value.Help: This is the intensity of the Fan LED strip when the switch is off. This is useful for users to see the light switch location when the lights are off. Range: 0-10 Default: 1

Value.label: Light LED Strip Effect
Value.Help: Please see website for documentation. Byte 4: Duration - 1 to 60 = seconds, 61 to 120 minutes, 121 - 254 = hours, 255 = Indefinitely Byte 3: Effect - 0 = Solid, 1 = Slow Blink, 2 = Fast Blink, 3 = Chase, 4 = Pulse Byte 2: Intensity - 0 to 9. 0 = dim, 9 = bright Byte 1: Color - 0 - 255. Hue color wheel. value/255 * 350 = Hue color wheel value Range: 0-2147483648 Default: 0

Value.label: Fan LED Strip Effect
Value.Help: Please see website for documentation. Byte 4: Duration - 1 to 60 = seconds, 61 to 120 minutes, 121 - 254 = hours, 255 = Indefinitely Byte 3: Effect - 0 = Solid, 1 = Slow Blink, 2 = Fast Blink, 3 = Chase, 4 = Pulse Byte 2: Intensity - 0 to 9. 0 = dim, 9 = bright Byte 1: Color - 0 - 255. Hue color wheel. value/255 * 350 = Hue color wheel value Range: 0-2147483648 Default: 0

Value.label: Light LED Strip Timeout
Value.Help: When the LED strip is disabled (Light LED Strip Intensity is set to 0), this setting allows the LED strip to turn on temporarily while being adjusted. Range: 0-10 Default: 3

Value.label: Fan LED Strip Timeout
Value.Help: When the LED strip is disabled (Fan LED Strip Intensity is set to 0), this setting allows the LED strip to turn on temporarily while being adjusted. Range: 0-10 Default: 3

Value.label: Active Power Reports
Value.Help: The power level change that will result in a new power report being sent. The value is a percentage of the previous report. 0 = disabled. Range:0-100 Default: 10

Value.label: Periodic Power & Energy Reports
Value.Help: Time period between consecutive power & energy reports being sent (in seconds). The timer is reset after each report is sent. Range:0-32767 Default: 3600

Value.label: Energy Reports
Value.Help: The energy level change that will result in a new energy report being sent. The value is a percentage of the previous report. Range:0-100 Default: 10
